thread.title: Travel gadgets: Plantronics BackBeat Fit, Alcatel OneTouch Pixi 3, Bose QuiteComfort CQ20
thread.title_full: Travel gadgets: Plantronics BackBeat Fit, Alcatel OneTouch Pixi 3, Bose QuiteComfort CQ20 | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Advertiser

author: Rod Chester
title: Travel gadgets: Plantronics BackBeat Fit, Alcatel OneTouch Pixi 3, Bose QuiteComfort CQ20
text:
HERE is the best of the latest gadget news.
Plantronics BackBeat Fit, $159
Waterproof and rugged for the intrepid traveller. Source: Supplied
You don’t have to be a runner to love these wireless headphones. This improved model, which now comes in lava red, is waterproof, so you don’t need to worry about being caught in torrential downpours, and it has a rugged strap across the back of your head with reflective stripes to help you stand out in the dark. The headphones come with a handy reversible carry pouch that doubles as an armband for your phone.
plantronics.com/au
MORE: PROTECTING SMARTPHONE AND A GO-PRO
HOW TO GET THE BEST SEAT ON A PLANE
Alcatel OneTouch Pixi 3 , $59
An Android 3G phone at a budget-friendly price for travelling. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
If the idea of taking your fancy, and expensive, smartphone on a rough and ready adventure sends you into a panic, this budget-priced and basic smartphone could offer a solution. It’s an Android 3G phone with just a 2 megapixel camera and 4-inch screen. But it comes in a range of colours and has a budget-friendly price that means you won’t stress if it doesn’t survive the trip.
optus.com.au
Bose QuiteComfort CQ20, $399
Features an Aware mode that let’s your hear outsi9de noise if you need to. Source: Supplied
These in-ear headphones offer the peace and quiet of noise cancelling mode with soft tips to keep them comfortably in your ears for hours at a time. When you need to be aware of the outside world, such as when you’re waiting for that boarding announcement, you can flick a switch to turn on Aware mode, that lets you hear outside noise as well as your choice of music. A rechargeable battery keeps noise cancelling going for 16 hours although the music still plays on when you run out of juice.
bose.com.au
World Time Buddy , Free
The easy way to convert time zones. Source: Supplied
This simple app takes the brain strain out of converting time zones. Select a range of locations and then slide a strip along to find how the time zones match up. Great for when you’re trying to work out the best time to call home.
Apple iOS
